intro: Alectra virgata, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Alectra virgata is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to harsh, sun-exposed conditions.
